Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic epistolary text, 27 ll. on recto and 20 ll. on verso. Letter about payment of debt. 20 ii 159 BC, Memphis; complete. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Letter from Hor son of P-necht(?) to the scribe of Hery-wbast (Eriubastis) the strategus. Date. year 22 of unnamed King. perhaps Ptol. Philometor (if so, BC 159). Origin. Serapeum, Memphis".
Curator's comments: published Revillout, Corpus Papysorum II pl. III, and rev. eg. V 47. Sethe, burgsehaftsurkunden 1920 p.433 pl.52-54. Published by Depauw, The Demotic Letter (2006), 29 with bibliography. P BM EA 10785-6 probably form an archive with 10231, 10242, 10405-6 (Muhs, pers. comm.).
Bibliographic references: Revillout 1888 / Papyrus Démotiques du British Museum, Premier Fascicule (p.3, pl.3)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (43898) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/43898)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus Black ink Inlaid: brown paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: kraft paper Object Priority: B Mount Priority: B Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: fair
